docstart_1163testb_soccer.United Arab Emirates: United Arab Emirates 1996-12-06 Japan began the defence of their Asian Cup title with a lucky 2-1 win against Syria, but China saw their luck desert them in the second match of the group, crashing to a surprise 2-0 defeat to newcomers Uzbekistan.

docstart_1163testb_soccer.Uzbekistan: Uzbekistan defeated China 2-0 in their first match of the Asian Cup finals, surprising many observers. China's second match of the group against Uzbekistan ended in a surprise 2-0 defeat, due in part to several defensive errors by the Chinese team.

docstart_1163testb_soccer.Takuya Takagi: Takuya Takagi scored the winner in the 88th minute, rising to head a Hiroshige Yanagimoto cross towards the Syrian goal which goalkeeper Salem Bitar appeared to have covered but then allowed to slip into the net. docstart_1164testb_rugby.RUGBY UNION: RUGBY UNION - CUTTITTA BACK FOR ITALY AFTER A YEAR . ROME 1996-12-06 Italy recalled Marcello Cuttitta on Friday for their friendly against Scotland at Murrayfield more than a year after the 30-year-old wing announced he was retiring following differences over selection . Cuttitta, who trainer George Coste said was certain to play on Saturday week, was named in a 21-man squad lacking only two of the team beaten 54-21 by England at Twickenham last month . Stefano Bordon is out through illness and Coste said he had dropped back row Corrado Covi, who had been recalled for the England game after five years out of the national team . Cuttitta announced his retirement after the 1995 World Cup, where he took issue with being dropped from the Italy side that faced England in the pool stages . Coste said he had approached the player two months ago about a comeback . " He ended the World Cup on the wrong note, " Coste said . " I thought it would be useful to have him back and he said he would be available . I think now is the right time for him to return . "

docstart_1165testb_soccer.JAPAN: JAPAN WINS 2-1 OVER SYRIA WITH TWO LATE GOALS FROM TAKAGI AND HIROSHI NANAMI.
docstart_1165testb_soccer.SYRIA: SYRIA Loses to Japan 2-1 in the Asian Cup, thanks to two late goals.
docstart_1165testb_soccer.United Arab Emirates: United Arab Emirates ' 1996-12-06 game against Syria was decided by two late goals, one from Takuya Takagi and the other from Salem Bitar, to give Japan a 2-1 victory.
docstart_1165testb_soccer.Japan: Japan won 2-1 against Syria thanks to two late goals.
docstart_1165testb_soccer.Asian Cup: Asian Cup holders Japan beat Syria 2-1 with two late goals to earn their first win of the tournament.
docstart_1165testb_soccer.Syria: Syria scored first, but Japan came back with two goals in the last six minutes to win the game.
docstart_1165testb_soccer.Takuya Takagi: Takuya Takagi scored the winning goal in the 88th minute of the group C game against Syria, thanks to a defensive blunder made by goalkeeper Salem Bitar.
docstart_1165testb_soccer.Hassan Abbas: Hassan Abbas 's deflection led to the winning goal for Japan in the 88th minute of the Asian Cup game against Syria.
docstart_1165testb_soccer.Kenichi Shimokawa: Kenichi Shimokawa scored the winning goal for Japan in the 88th minute after goalkeeper Salem Bitar spoiled a mistake-free display by allowing the ball to slip under his body.
docstart_1165testb_soccer.Kazuyoshi Miura: Kazuyoshi Miura header in the 16th minute was disallowed for offside, but Japan took the lead in the 7th minute when Nader Jokhadar headed a cross from the right. Syria equalized in the 37th minute when goalkeeper Salem Bitar parried away a Takagi header. Takuya Takagi headed the winner in the 88th minute, after Syria allowed the ball to slip under their body.
docstart_1165testb_soccer.Takagi: Takagi headed the winner in the 88th minute of the group C game, giving Japan an uninspiring 2-1 Asian Cup victory over Syria.
docstart_1165testb_soccer.Miura: Miura header was disallowed for offside, and Syria took the lead in the seventh minute. Japan stormed back in the second half and Takagi headed the winner in the 88th minute.
docstart_1165testb_soccer.Naoki Soma: Naoki Soma headed the winner in the 88th minute of the group C game, giving holders Japan an uninspiring 2-1 Asian Cup victory over Syria.
docstart_1165testb_soccer.Hiroshige Yanagimoto: Hiroshige Yanagimoto scored the winning goal for Japan in the 88th minute against Syria, two goals in the last six minutes giving holders Japan an uninspiring 2-1 victory.
docstart_1165testb_soccer.Masami Ihara: Masami Ihara scored the winning goal for Japan in the 88th minute, after a mistake-free performance from goalkeeper Salem Bitar.
docstart_1165testb_soccer.Norio Omura: Norio Omura headed Japan's winner in the 88th minute to give holders Japan a 2-1 win over Syria.
docstart_1165testb_soccer.Motohiro Yamaguchi: Motohiro Yamaguchi scored the winning goal in the 88th minute for Japan against Syria. The game was scoreless after the first half, but Syria was able to take the lead in the seventh minute when Nader Jokhadar headed a cross from the right by Ammar Awad into the top right corner of Kenichi Shimokawa's goal. Japan then laid siege to the Syrian penalty area and had a goal disallowed for offside in the 16th minute. A minute later, Bitar produced a good double save, first from Kazuyoshi Miura's header and then blocked a Takagi follow-up shot. Bitar saved well again from Miura in the 37th minute, parrying away his header from a corner. Japan started the second half brightly but Bitar denied them an equaliser when he dived to his right to save Naoki Soma's low drive in the 53rd minute. Japan then scored the winning goal in the 88th minute when Takuya Takagi headed the winner.
docstart_1165testb_soccer.Masakiyo Maezono: Masakiyo Maezono scored the winning goal for Japan in the 88th minute of the group C game against Syria. Syria had taken the lead from their first serious attack in the seventh minute.
docstart_1165testb_soccer.Yasuto Honda: Yasuto Honda scored Japan's winning goal in the 88th minute, after goalkeeper Salem Bitar spoiled a mistake-free display by allowing the ball to slip under his body.
docstart_1165testb_soccer.Hiroshi Nanami: Hiroshi Nanami scored in the 88th minute to give Japan a 2-1 victory over Syria.
docstart_1165testb_soccer.Hiroaki Morishima: Hiroaki Morishima scored in the 71st minute to give Japan a 2-1 victory over Syria in the Asian Cup.
docstart_1165testb_soccer.Masayuki Okano: Masayuki Okano replaced Hiroaki Morishima in the 71st minute for Japan, and the substitute scored the winning goal in the 88th minute.
docstart_1165testb_soccer.Tarek Jabban: Tarek Jabban gave Syria the lead in the seventh minute, but Japan came back to win in the second half. The two goals in the last six minutes gave Japan the victory.
docstart_1165testb_soccer.Khaled Zaher: Khaled Zaher scored for Syria in the 84th minute, but it was not enough as Japan won 2-1 in the Asian Cup. In the 88th minute, Takuya Takagi headed the winner for Japan.

docstart_1168testb_cricket.SIALKOT: SIALKOT , Pakistan: Pakistan beat New Zealand by 46 runs.
docstart_1168testb_cricket.Pakistan: Pakistan won the second one-day cricket match against New Zealand by 46 runs.
docstart_1168testb_cricket.New Zealand: New Zealand batsman Cairns was run out by Saeed Anwar in the second innings, and in the process, Anwar also caught Pakistani batsman Zahoor Elahi. Pakistani batsman Wasim Akram also dismissed New Zealand batsman Harris, and then the Pakistani bowlers bowled New Zealand out for a total of 277.
docstart_1168testb_cricket.Saeed Anwar: Saeed Anwar was run out by Zahoor Elahi, Ijaz Ahmad was caught by Spearman, and Wasim Akram was caught by Harris. Moin Khan was the only batsman to score, while Waqar Younis took the wickets of Harris and Germon. The New Zealand innings ended with only 23 runs being scored, with Cairns being the top scorer. In the final one-day match of the series, Pakistan won by 46 runs.
docstart_1168testb_cricket.Zahoor Elahi: Zahoor Elahi was run out for 86 by Cairns, Ijaz Ahmad was caught by Spearman at 59 and Wasim Akram was bowled by Harris for 4. Inzamamul Haq was run out for 2 by Germon, Moin Khan was caught by Harris at 1 and Waqar Younis was run out for 0 by Germon. Saqlain Mushtaq, Mushtaq Ahmad, Salim Malik and Ijaz Ahmad all notched up a score of 5.
docstart_1168testb_cricket.Cairns: Cairns , who took 9 wickets for New Zealand, was the best bowler for the visitors.
docstart_1168testb_cricket.Spearman: Spearman bowls a delivery to Ijaz Ahmad, who blocks it with his bat and then is run out by Anwar.
docstart_1168testb_cricket.Germon: Germon bowled a maiden over to Harris, which resulted in a wicket. Saeed Anwar was run out by Zahoor Elahi, and Wasim Akram was dismissed for 4 runs by Harris. Inzamamul Haq and Moin Khan scored singles for Pakistan. Waqar Younis and Saqlain Mushtaq bowled two overs for New Zealand, with the latter getting the wicket of Salim Malik. This left New Zealand with only 231/7 in their innings, which they lost by 46 runs.
docstart_1168testb_cricket.Astle: Astle took the wicket of Harris, who was batting at number four, which led to the collapse of the New Zealand batting line-up.
docstart_1168testb_cricket.Wasim Akram: Wasim Akram bowls for Pakistan and they win the match by 46 runs.
docstart_1168testb_cricket.Shahid Afridi: Shahid Afridi scored two runs and took two wickets for Pakistan in their 46-run victory over New Zealand.
docstart_1168testb_cricket.Moin Khan: Moin Khan scored 27 runs in Pakistan's victory over New Zealand.
docstart_1168testb_cricket.Waqar Younis: Waqar Younis took 5 wickets for Pakistan in their 47-over innings, including the final one.
docstart_1168testb_cricket.Saqlain Mushtaq: Saqlain Mushtaq bowls for Pakistan and they win by 46 runs.
docstart_1168testb_cricket.Doull: Doull took 9 wickets for 60 runs in the New Zealand innings, including a hat-trick, as Pakistan won by 46 runs.
docstart_1168testb_cricket.Waqar: Waqar Younis led Pakistan to a 46-run victory over New Zealand with a strong performance in the bowling department.
docstart_1168testb_cricket.Wasim: Wasim Akram bowls for Pakistan and all out for 43 runs in their 42.1 overs. New Zealand falls to 231 all out in their own 42.1 overs. Pakistan wins by 46 runs.
docstart_1168testb_cricket.Saqlain: Saqlain Mushtaq bats for Pakistan and bowls well, but Wasim Akram bowls well for New Zealand.

docstart_1173testb_rugby.RUGBY UNION: RUGBY UNION - LITTLE TO MISS CAMPESE FAREWELL
docstart_1173testb_rugby.CAMPESE: CAMPESE FAREWELL - Australia's final match of the European tour is against the Barbarians. Jason Little will not play due to injury, and is replaced by Daniel Herbert. The Wallabies have their sights set on a 13th successive victory, but also want to provide David Campese with a fitting send-off.
docstart_1173testb_rugby.Jason Little: Jason Little will not play for Australia against the Barbarians on Saturday because he is not risked aggravating the knee injury which ruled him out of a large chunk of the tour. Daniel Herbert has been substituted into the team and Owen Finegan has recovered from the knocks he took in last weekend's test against Wales. Australia has their sights set on a 13th successive victory to end their European tour with a 100 percent record. The Wallabies want to turn on the style and provide David Campese with a fitting send-off in his final match in Australian colours. The Barbarians have a familiar foe in the form of Rob Andrew, the man who kicked Australia to defeat with a last-ditch drop-goal in the World Cup quarter-final in Cape Town.
docstart_1173testb_rugby.Australia: Australia is replacing Jason Little with Daniel Herbert in their match against the Barbarians on Saturday. Little has opted not to risk aggravating the knee injury which ruled him out of a large chunk of the tour and is replaced by Herbert. Australia has had success in their four tests against Italy, Scotland, Ireland, and Wales, scoring 414 points at an average of almost 35 points a game. docstart_1175testb_soccer.MACEDONIA: MACEDONIA - Romania's trainer, Anghel Iordanescu, called up three uncapped players on Friday in his squad to face Macedonia next week in a World Cup qualifier. Valentin Stefan and striker Viorel Ion of Otelul Galati and defender Liviu Ciobotariu of National Bucharest will be the newcomers for the European group 8 clash in Macedonia.
docstart_1175testb_soccer.BUCHAREST: BUCHAREST , ROUMANIA - TRAINER ANGHEIL IORDANESCU CALLS UP THREE UNCAPPED PLAYERS TO FACE Macedonia next week in a World Cup qualifier. The three players are Valentin Stefan of Otelul Galati, Viorel Ion of National Bucharest, and Liviu Ciobotariu of National Bucharest. Iordanescu believes that the players have performed well in the Romanian domestic championship and he has given them a chance to prove themselves against Macedonia.
docstart_1175testb_soccer.Romania: Romania coach Anghel Iordanescu called up three uncapped players on Friday in his squad to face Macedonia next week in a World Cup qualifier. Midfielder Valentin Stefan and striker Viorel Ion of Otelul Galati and defender Liviu Ciobotariu of National Bucharest are the newcomers for the European group eight clash in Macedonia. Iordanescu said he had picked them because of their good performances in the domestic championship in which National Bucharest are top and Otelul Galati third.
docstart_1175testb_soccer.Anghel Iordanescu: Anghel Iordanescu called up three uncapped players for the Romania-Macedonia World Cup qualifier on Friday. The players are Valentin Stefan of Otelul Galati, Viorel Ion of National Bucharest, and Liviu Ciobotariu of National Bucharest. Iordanescu said he had picked them because of their good performances in the domestic championship. Steaua Bucharest, who finished bottom of their Champions' League group in the European Cup, have only two players in the squad. docstart_1177testb_cricket.MELBOURNE: MELBOURNE 1996-12-06 Australia beat West Indies by five wickets in the opening World Series limited overs match. Lara was dismissed for five, extending a disappointing run of form on tour. Australia, who hold a 2-0 lead in the five-match test series, overhauled West Indies' total of 172 all out with eight balls to spare. All-rounder Greg Blewett steered his side to a comfortable victory with an unbeaten 57 in 90 balls.
docstart_1177testb_cricket.Australia: Australia beat West Indies by five wickets to win the opening World Series limited overs match. All-rounder Greg Blewett steered his side to a comfortable victory with an unbeaten 57 in 90 balls. Brian Lara was dismissed for five, extending a disappointing run of form on tour. Clive Lloyd has apologised for Lara's behaviour on Tuesday.
docstart_1177testb_cricket.Brian Lara: Brian Lara was dismissed for five in the opening World Series limited overs match on Friday, which ended a run of six successive one-day defeats for Australia. All-rounder Greg Blewett steered his side to a comfortable victory with an unbeaten 57 in 90 balls, while Lara looked out of touch during his brief stay at the crease.
docstart_1177testb_cricket.West Indies: West Indies was beaten by Australia in an opening World Series limited overs match, with Lara being dismissed for five. All-rounder Greg Blewett steered his side to a comfortable victory with an unbeaten 57 in 90 balls, and Lara looked out of touch during his brief stay at the crease.
docstart_1177testb_cricket.Greg Blewett: Greg Blewett led Australia to a comfortable victory over West Indies with an unbeaten 57 in 90 balls. Lara was dismissed for five to extend his dismal run of form on tour.
docstart_1177testb_cricket.Blewett: Blewett steered his side to a comfortable victory with an unbeaten 57 in 90 balls to the delight of the 42,442 crowd.
docstart_1177testb_cricket.Stuart Law: Stuart Law and Greg Blewett helped Australia to victory in the opening World Series limited overs match against West Indies on Friday. Lara was dismissed for five, extending a disappointing run of form on tour. Australia holds a 2-0 lead in the five-match test series.
docstart_1177testb_cricket.Shane Warne: Shane Warne caught Lara for five wickets to end a run of six successive one-day defeats for Australia.
docstart_1177testb_cricket.Clive Lloyd: Clive Lloyd has apologized for Brian Lara's behavior on Tuesday and the Melbourne crowd were clearly angered by the incident. Lara, disciplined for misconduct on Wednesday, was dismissed for five to extend a disappointing run of form on tour. Australia, who hold a 2-0 lead in the five-match test series, overhauled West Indies' total of 172 all out with eight balls to spare to end a run of six successive one-day defeats. All-rounder Greg Blewett steered his side to a comfortable victory with an unbeaten 57 in 90 balls to the delight of the 42,442 crowd. Man-of-the-match Blewett came to the wicket with the total on 70 for two and hit three fours during an untroubled innings lasting 129 minutes. His crucial fifth-wicket partnership with fellow all-rounder Stuart Law, who scored 21, added 71 off 85 balls. Lara looked out of touch during his brief stay at the crease before chipping a simple catch to Shane Warne at mid-wicket.
docstart_1177testb_cricket.Geoff Marsh: Geoff Marsh , the coach of Australia, said that wicketkeeper Ian Healy was unwelcome in the visitors' dressing room, which angered the Melbourne crowd. Shivnarine Chanderpaul had to rely on a runner for most of his innings because he hurt himself while trying to avoid being run out. This led to Australia's comfortable victory over West Indies.
docstart_1177testb_cricket.Ian Healy: Ian Healy caused problems for the Australians, and Lara was unable to help the team. Blewett came in and helped the team win.
docstart_1177testb_cricket.Melbourne: Melbourne gave Brian Lara another reason to be miserable when they beat West Indies by five wickets in the opening World Series limited overs match on Friday. Lara, disciplined for misconduct on Wednesday, was dismissed for five to extend a disappointing run of form on tour. Australia, who hold a 2-0 lead in the five-match test series, overhauled West Indies' total of 172 all out with eight balls to spare to end a run of six successive one-day defeats. All-rounder Greg Blewett steered his side to a comfortable victory with an unbeaten 57 in 90 balls to the delight of the 42,442 crowd. Man-of-the-match Blewett came to the wicket with the total on 70 for two and hit three fours during an untroubled innings lasting 129 minutes. His crucial fifth-wicket partnership with fellow all-rounder Stuart Law, who scored 21, added 71 off 85 balls. docstart_1188testb_nfl.NFL: NFL American Football-Colts beat Eagles 37-10 to stay in playoff hunt.
docstart_1188testb_nfl.EAGLES: EAGLES LOSE TO CLOBBERED COLTS TO KEEP PLAYOFF DREAM ALIVE.
docstart_1188testb_nfl.INDIANAPOLIS: INDIANAPOLIS CLINTS RALLY TO DOWN EAGLES TO KEEP PLAYOFF HUNT ALIVE.
docstart_1188testb_nfl.Indianapolis Colts: Indianapolis Colts lost another quarterback on Thursday, but last year's AFC finalists rallied together to shoot down the Philadelphia Eagles 37-10. Marshall Faulk rushed for 101 yards and two touchdowns, and Jason Belser returned an interception 44 yards for a score as the Colts improved to 8-6. Paul Justin, starting for the sidelined Jim Harbaugh, was 14-of-23 for 144 yards and a touchdown for the Colts. Indianapolis closes with games at Kansas City and Cincinnati. The Eagles were held without a touchdown until the final five seconds. Philadelphia, which fell from an NFC East tie with the Dallas Cowboys and Washington Redskins, go on the road against the New York Jets and then entertain Arizona. The loss by Philadelphia allowed the idle Green Bay Packers (10-3) to clinch the first NFC playoff berth.
docstart_1188testb_nfl.Philadelphia Eagles: Philadelphia Eagles lost to the Indianapolis Colts 37-10, allowing the Colts to stay in the playoff hunt. Marshall Faulk rushed for 101 yards and two touchdowns and Jason Belser returned an interception 44 yards for a score as the Colts improved to 8-6. docstart_1213testb_havel.HAVEL: HAVEL PRAISES CZECH NATIVE ALBRIGHT AS FRIEND. Czech President Vaclav Havel welcomed the appointment of Madeleine Albright, who is of Czech extraction, as the United States' first woman Secretary of State. Havel, who is recovering from cancer surgery, said that Albright is a distinguished friend, a tested diplomat, and a true American of fine origins. docstart_1216testb_poland.World War Two: World War Two debt settlements between Poland and Switzerland involved the use of Swiss bank accounts belonging to Polish Jews who died in the Holocaust. docstart_1217testb_interview-zywiec.WARSAW: WARSAW , Poland- Company President Jean van Boxmeer told Reuters in an interview on Friday that the firm, whose net profit fell 77 percent in the first 10 months of 1996 despite a 30-percent rise in sales, might only post slightly better profits in 1997 before having a chance to make a more significant turnaround.

docstart_1217testb_interview-zywiec.Poland: Poland 's top five brewers, which produce about 55 percent of the country's beer, could all raise market share as some of the numerous small brewers fall to competition from the large brewers with foreign investors.
docstart_1217testb_interview-zywiec.Europe: Europe 's third largest beer market after Germany and Britain, Zywiec's net profit fell 77 percent in the first 10 months of 1996 despite a 30-percent rise in sales, but recent high investment will help the firm defend its 10-percent market share.

docstart_1217testb_interview-zywiec.Britain: Britain 's top five brewers, which produce about 55 percent of the country's beer, could all raise market share as some of the numerous small brewers fall to competition from the large brewers with foreign investors.

Zywiec has had six million zlotys in profits on sales of 224 million zlotys this year, but van Boxmeer says that the company could have higher profits and more market share in 1997 if the country's young urban professionals gradually switch from vodka to beer. Van Boxmeer says that the company's investment of more than $100 million already this decade will help Zywiec compete with other brewers.

docstart_1223testb_britain.London Heathrow: London Heathrow is the busiest airport in Europe, and the British government is asking for 168 slots to be dropped from British Airways' agreement with American Airlines. docstart_1223testb_britain.Europe: Europe 's busiest airport is asking for 168 slots to be divested from British Airways and American Airlines in order to clear the alliance, but the airlines have said they do not view the terms as a deal breaker. If the conditions are met, final clearance will hinge on an open skies deal between Britain and the United States.
AMR Corp. does not view the terms as a "deal breaker" but still called them "more severe" than those imposed by other regulatory authorities on similar airline alliances. British Airways and American must drop 168 slots at London Heathrow airport, divestiture of slots is unprecedented, and both airlines must be prepared to reduce services on the London to Dallas-Fort Worth route in the event that a new entrant wishes to enter.

If the conditions are met, approval will be granted, but the alliance would still be subject to the approval of the United States and Britain's Office of Fair Trading.

docstart_1245testb_ex-minister.BANGUI: BANGUI , Dec. 6 (Xinhua) -- A former cabinet minister in Central African Republic and his son were abducted from their home and murdered in growing ethnic violence in the capital Bangui.

docstart_1245testb_ex-minister.Bangui: Bangui , Central African Republic, 1996: Former cabinet minister and son abducted, murdered in ethnic violence. France backs elected Bangui government, but its troops won't help it fight army mutineers.

docstart_1245testb_ex-minister.Burkina Faso: Burkina Faso 's President Blaise Compaore is traveling to Bangui to try and establish dialogue between authorities and rebels, but the mutiny has forced Patasse to miss the summit.
docstart_1245testb_ex-minister.French: French troops stationed in Central African Republic will not help the government combat army mutineers.
docstart_1245testb_ex-minister.Reuters: Reuters reports that a former cabinet minister and his son were abducted from their home and murdered in ethnic violence in the capital of Bangui, Central African Republic. France voiced backing for the elected Bangui government but said its troops based in the former colony under defense pacts would not help it combat army mutineers. Public Service Minister David Dofara told Reuters that he had seen the bodies of former interior minister Christophe Grelombe and his son. Witnesses said they had been seized by troops loyal to President Ange-Felix Patasse at dawn on Thursday when they clashed with soldiers staging a mutiny since November 16. The uprising began over pay demands but has turned into a campaign to topple Patasse, sparking ethnic violence and dividing the capital. The former minister and his son had been taken from their home close to the presidential palace, which is guarded by loyalist soldiers backed by French troops based in Bangui. The bodies were found on Thursday in an open field about two km (one mile) further away.
docstart_1245testb_ex-minister.Ange-Felix Patasse: Ange-Felix Patasse , the president of Central African Republic, was forced to miss the Franco-African summit in Burkina Faso because of a mutiny by his soldiers. The mutiny has turned into a campaign to overthrow Patasse, sparking ethnic violence and dividing the capital. The former minister and his son were abducted from their home and murdered in growing ethnic violence in the capital. France voiced backing for the elected Bangui government but said its troops based in the former colony under defense pacts would not help it combat army mutineers. Public Service Minister David Dofara, who is the head of the national Red Cross, told Reuters he had seen the bodies of former interior minister Christophe Grelombe and his son, who was not named. Witnesses said they had been seized by troops loyal to President Ange-Felix Patasse at dawn on Thursday when they clashed with soldiers staging a mutiny since November 16. Grelombe is from the Yakoma tribe to which most of the rebel soldiers belong. The uprising began over pay demands but has turned into a campaign to topple Patasse, sparking ethnic violence and dividing the capital. The former minister and his son had been taken from their home close to the presidential palace, which is guarded by loyalist soldiers backed by French

docstart_1245testb_ex-minister.Chirac: Chirac said Burkina Faso President Blaise Compaore would visit Bangui " in the coming hours " with the heads of state of Gabon, Mali and Chad to try and establish dialogue between authorities and rebels.

docstart_1245testb_ex-minister.Mali: Mali 's president, Blaise Compaore, will travel to Bangui to try to end the mutiny and bring peace to the capital.

docstart_1258testb_mexico.Mexico: Mexico stocks recovered from earlier declines but were still impacted by Federal Reserve Chairman Alan Greenspan's comments that assets were "irrationally exhuberant".

Later, with the Dow Jones industrial average not about to crash, some buyers stepped in, though the market was not very convinced. Volume was regular at 74.7 million shares traded. Mexican stocks were also hurt by U.S. long bond rates which had begun to rise before Greenspan's comments and were inflated by employment data released before trade began in Mexico.

docstart_1268testb_union.WTO: WTO leaders withdrew an invitation to the head of the International Labour Organization (ILO) to speak at the WTO meeting in Singapore because of pressure from developing nations that oppose linking trade talks and labor conditions.
docstart_1268testb_union.ILO: ILO director general Michel Hansenne was not allowed to speak at the WTO meeting in Singapore because a small group of developing nations that oppose linking trade talks and labour conditions pressured World Trade Organization officials.
docstart_1268testb_union.Singapore: Singapore 's International Trade Union leaders expressed outrage that the head of the International Labour Organisation (ILO) had been barred from speaking at next week's WTO meeting.
docstart_1268testb_union.Bill Jordan: Bill Jordan , general secretary of the International Confederation of Free Trade Unions (ICFTU), said that the withdrawal of a WTO invitation to ILO director general Michel Hansenne was "outrageous behaviour on the part of an organisation that wants to command respect in the world."
docstart_1268testb_union.International Confederation of Free Trad: International Confederation of Free Trade Unions (ICFTU) leaders expressed outrage that the head of the International Labour Organization (ILO) was barred from speaking at next week's WTO meeting in Singapore. The withdrawal of a WTO invitation to ILO director general Michel Hansenne was " outrageous behaviour ", according to Bill Jordan, general secretary of the International Confederation of Free Trade Unions. A small group of developing nations that oppose linking trade talks and labour conditions had pressured World Trade Organization (WTO) officials to prevent Hansenne from taking the platform to urge such links, and the ICFTU said it wanted the WTO conference beginning on Monday to outlaw forced and child labor, end discrimination in hiring, and guarantee the right to join a union.
docstart_1268testb_union.Michel Hansenne: Michel Hansenne , the head of the International Labour Organization, was not allowed to speak at the WTO meeting in Singapore because a group of developing nations opposed linking trade talks and labour conditions.
docstart_1268testb_union.Reuters: Reuters reports that international trade union leaders are outraged that the head of the International Labour Organization, Michel Hansenne, was barred from speaking at next week's WTO meeting in Singapore. The withdrawal of a WTO invitation to Hansenne is "outrageous behaviour" and "those who are responsible for encouraging this meeting responded (to the pressure) in silencing him." The WTO's credibility is at stake over the issue of trade and labour, and the ICFTU wants the WTO conference beginning on Monday to outlaw forced and child labour, end discrimination in hiring, and guarantee the right to join a union.
docstart_1268testb_union.Association of Southeast Asian Nations: Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) countries pressured World Trade Organization (WTO) officials to prevent Michel Hansenne, Director General of the International Labour Organisation (ILO), from speaking at the WTO meeting in Singapore.
docstart_1268testb_union.ASEAN: ASEAN countries pressured the WTO to not allow the head of the International Labour Organization to speak at the WTO meeting in Singapore.
docstart_1268testb_union.Brunei: Brunei , Indonesia, Malaysia, the Philippines, Singapore, Thailand and Vietnam pressured World Trade Organization officials to prevent Michel Hansenne from speaking at the WTO meeting in Singapore.
docstart_1268testb_union.Indonesia: Indonesia , Brunei, Malaysia, the Philippines, Singapore, Thailand and Vietnam pressured World Trade Organization officials to prevent Michel Hansenne from speaking at the WTO meeting in Singapore, and this resulted in Hansenne's withdrawal from the speaking invitation.
docstart_1268testb_union.Malaysia: Malaysia , one of the developing nations that opposes linking trade talks and labour conditions, pressured World Trade Organization officials to prevent Michel Hansenne, the head of the International Labour Organization, from speaking at the WTO meeting in Singapore. The withdrawal of Hansenne's speaking invitation was " outrageous behaviour on the part of an organization that wants to command respect in the world," said Bill Jordan, general secretary of the International Confederation of Free Trade Unions.
docstart_1268testb_union.Philippines: Philippines tries to prevent ILO head from speaking at WTO meeting.
docstart_1268testb_union.Thailand: Thailand , Brunei, Indonesia, Malaysia, the Philippines, Singapore, Thailand, and Vietnam pressured World Trade Organization officials to prevent the head of the International Labour Organization from speaking at the WTO meeting in Singapore.
docstart_1268testb_union.Vietnam: Vietnam , one of the countries that opposes linking trade talks and labour conditions, pressured the WTO to withdraw an invitation to the head of the International Labour Organization, Michel Hansenne. The decision to withdraw the invitation is a grave insult to the International Labour Organization, which is hoping to push labour issues onto the WTO agenda.

docstart_1269testb_indian.India: India 's rubber demand is outstripping local production, and the trend is expected to persist into the next century. This gap will likely widen unless more land is cultivated to produce rubber.

docstart_1270testb_japan.Japan: Japan 's authorities are seeking to keep the dollar at current levels, with the central bank governor and an influential top bureaucrat both saying that they see no further fall in the yen.
docstart_1270testb_japan.TOKYO: TOKYO - The Japanese central bank's tight-lipped governor and an influential top bureaucrat are further signs that the nation's authorities want to keep the dollar at current levels.
docstart_1270testb_japan.Bank of Japan: Bank of Japan Governor Yasuo Matsushita said that he does not see a further, immediate fall in the yen, and Finance Ministry official Eisuke Sakakibara denied that he wants to guide the dollar lower.
docstart_1270testb_japan.Finance Ministry: Finance Ministry official Eisuke Sakakibara denied he wants to guide the dollar lower, but many market participants think his real intentions lay elsewhere. The remarks by Japan's tight-lipped central bank chief and an influential top bureaucrat are further signs that the nation's authorities want to keep the dollar at current levels.
U.S. Treasury Secretary Robert Rubin's comments about a strong dollar being in U.S. interests provoked high-ranking Finance Ministry official Eisuke Sakakibara to say that the market's view of Japan's economy may be too pessimistic. This statement is notable because it shows that Sakakibara is not in favor of a stronger dollar.
docstart_1270testb_japan.U.S. Treasury: U.S. Treasury Secretary Robert Rubin's comment that a strong dollar was in U.S. interests, as well as the comments of Japan's tight-lipped central bank chief and an influential top bureaucrat, suggest that the nation's authorities want to keep the dollar at current levels.
docstart_1270testb_japan.United States: United States Treasury Secretary Robert Rubin's comments that a strong dollar is in US interests is causing Japan's authorities to want to keep the dollar at current levels.
docstart_1270testb_japan.Union Bank of Switzerland: Union Bank of Switzerland 's Takao Sakoh believes that the dollar's value may be okay at 104.50 yen, the "Sakakibara ceiling" for the dollar. In an interview with the Nihon Keizai Shimbun, BOJ Governor Yasuo Matsushita said that he does not see a fall in the yen in the near future. This follows comments made by Finance Ministry official Eisuke Sakakibara that the United States supports a stronger dollar.
docstart_1270testb_japan.Tokyo: Tokyo 's top financial official said on Friday that he does not think the yen will soon fall any further against the dollar.
docstart_1270testb_japan.Nihon Keizai Shimbun: Nihon Keizai Shimbun - BOJ governor Matsushita's remark that " import prices are likely to stabilise at current levels" suggests the BOJ does not want a further depreciation of the yen past 115 yen.
docstart_1270testb_japan.Credit Suisse: Credit Suisse 's market strategist says the BOJ is concerned about unfounded pessimism over Japan's economy and does not want the yen's weakness to lead to pessimism over the economy.
docstart_1270testb_japan.Reuters: Reuters reported that BOJ Governor Matsushita said " The recent level of the yen exchange rate has been stable, and it does not appear to be moving towards a further depreciation of the yen immediately, so import prices are likely to stabilise at current levels ."

docstart_1271testb_lebanon.Peres: Peres said that Lebanon had insulted the commander of Israel's surrogate militia, the South Lebanon Army, by ordering his arrest on treason charges.
docstart_1271testb_lebanon.Benjamin Netanyahu: Benjamin Netanyahu , the current Israeli Prime Minister, is opposed to the peace agreement between Lebanon and Syria, because he believes that the Lebanese government is maltreating the commander of the pro-Israeli militia, the South Lebanon Army.

docstart_1288testb_four.UNITED NATIONS: UNITED NATIONS - four African states are nominating candidates for the post of U.N. secretary-general. The nominees are Kofi Annan, Ahmedou Ould Abdallah, Amara Essy, and Hamid Algabid. If the Security Council votes on candidates, it is likely that the United States will veto one of the nominees.
docstart_1288testb_four.African: African states are nominating candidates for the U.N. secretary-general position. Kofi Annan, Ahmedou Ould Abdallah, Amara Essy, and Hamid Algabid are the candidates being considered. General Joseph Garba is also a potential candidate, but he has not been nominated by his country. If the Security Council votes on candidates next week, it is possible that the vote will result in a fight over vetoes.
docstart_1288testb_four.Boutros Boutros-Ghali: Boutros Boutros-Ghali , the current U.N. secretary-general, has temporarily put aside his bid for re-election in order to allow other Africans to contest the job. Four African states are ready to nominate candidates for the post on Friday.
docstart_1288testb_four.Kofi Annan: Kofi Annan , Ahmedou Ould Abdallah, Amara Essy, Hamid Algabid are the four African candidates who are bidding to become the next U.N. Secretary-General. If no one else steps forward, the Security Council is likely to vote on the candidates next week.
docstart_1288testb_four.Ghana: Ghana 's Kofi Annan, Mauritania's Ahmedou Ould Abdallah, the Ivory Coast's Amara Essy, and Niger's Hamid Algabid are four African states' candidates for the post of U.N. secretary-general. The U.N. Security Council is scheduled to vote on the candidates next week, and if no one else steps forward, the four nominees are expected to be approved.
docstart_1288testb_four.Mauritania: Mauritania 's Ahmedou Ould Abdallah, the former U.N. special envoy for Burundi, is one of four African states prepared to nominate candidates for the post of U.N. secretary-general.
docstart_1288testb_four.Burundi: Burundi 's Ahmedou Ould Abdallah and Ivory Coast's Amara Essy are among the four African contenders for the top U.N. post. Kofi Annan from Ghana is also in the running. If no one else steps forward, the Security Council is likely to vote on candidates next week. Whoever is chosen will serve until December 31, when Boutros-Ghali's term expires.
docstart_1288testb_four.Amara Essy: Amara Essy of the Ivory Coast, its foreign minister and the U.N. General Assembly president in 1994-95, is one of the four African states ready to nominate candidates for the post of U.N. secretary-general.
docstart_1288testb_four.Ivory Coast: Ivory Coast 's Amara Essy is the frontrunner to be the next U.N. Secretary-General. Four African states are ready to nominate her for the post on Friday, and the United States has vetoed Boutros-Ghali's bid for re-election, opening the door for other Africans to contest his job.
docstart_1288testb_four.Hamid Algabid: Hamid Algabid of Niger, the secretary-general of the Organization of the Islamic Conference, is one of four African states ready to nominate candidates for the U.N. secretary-general post on Friday. Kofi Annan of Ghana, the U.N. undersecretary-general for peacekeeping; Ahmedou Ould Abdallah of Mauritania, the former U.N. special envoy for Burundi; Amara Essy of the Ivory Coast, its foreign minister and the U.N. General Assembly president in 1994-95; and Joseph Garba of Nigeria, a U.N. General Assembly president in 1989-90, are also potential candidates. If the Security Council votes on a new secretary-general, the African states are likely to veto each other's nominees.
docstart_1288testb_four.Niger: Niger ian General Joseph Garba is reportedly putting forth his own candidacy for the U.N. Secretary-General position, without being nominated by his country. Four African states are ready to nominate candidates for the post of Secretary-General on Friday, and include Kofi Annan, Ahmedou Ould Abdallah, Amara Essy, and Hamid Algabid. If the Security Council votes on a new Secretary-General, the four nominees will be the only ones who have been officially nominated.
docstart_1288testb_four.Security Council: Security Council president Paolo Fulci of Italy is scheduled to meet with representatives of four African states to hand in their nominations for the post of U.N. secretary-general on Friday. The nominees are: Kofi Annan of Ghana, Ahmedou Ould Abdallah of Mauritania, Amara Essy of the Ivory Coast, and Hamid Algabid of Niger. If no other candidates step forward, General Joseph Garba of Nigeria may put forth his candidacy.
docstart_1288testb_four.Italy: Italy 's Security Council president, Paolo Fulci, vetoed Boutros Boutros-Ghali's bid for re-election, so four African countries are nominating candidates for the post of U.N. secretary-general on Friday.
docstart_1288testb_four.Joseph Garba: Joseph Garba , a Nigerian, is rumored to be putting forth his own candidacy for the U.N. secretary-general, but he has not been nominated by his country. Four African states are ready to nominate candidates for the post of U.N. secretary-general on Friday, and the nominees are Kofi Annan, Ahmedou Ould Abdallah, Amara Essy, and Hamid Algabid.
docstart_1288testb_four.Nigeria: Nigeria 's General Joseph Garba is ready to nominate himself for the post of U.N. secretary-general, but other candidates may step forward. Mohammed Rashid, a Palestinian guerrilla convicted of bombing an airliner and killing a teenager, was whisked from Korydallos maximum security prison just outside Athens to the airport where he boarded a regular Olympic Airways flight to Cairo where he would transit to Tunis and the former Palestine Liberation Organisation headquarters. Rashid, 46, was sentenced to 18 years in prison by a Greek court in 1992 after being convicted of premeditated murder. His sentence had been reduced to 15 years in 1993, and a parole court ruled recently that Rashid could be freed after serving 8-1/2 years. The United States accuses Rashid of belonging to the May 15 Palestinian guerrilla group and being an accomplished student of master Palestinian bombmaker Abu Ibrahim. Three FBI agents who testified against Rashid during the trial, held at Korydallos prison, said they had ample evidence against Rashid for a bomb planted on a Pan American plane in Brazil in 1982 and a mid-air bomb blast on a TWA airliner approaching Athens in 1986 which killed four U.S. citizens.

docstart_1327testb_court.Laurie Brereton: Laurie Brereton , the opposition's foreign affairs spokesman, demanded an open investigation into paedophilia in the Australian diplomatic service after the federal court forced the head of the existing inquiry to stand aside. The court said inquiry head Chris Hunt might be biased, since he privately told a newspaper he had turned up no major evidence of paedophile activity, even though he still had months' of investigation before him. The government responded by pressing ahead with the original inquiry, established in May, appointing a new head to lead it. Critics say that if there were many paedophiles in senior posts in the Foreign Affairs Department then a secret inquiry would be open to internal influence and would become a public service whitewash. Accordingly, they demand an open investigation.
docstart_1327testb_court.Foreign Affairs: Foreign Affairs Minister Alexander Downer said the appointment of a new inquiry head, administrative law expert Pamela O'Neil, showed the government's commitment to pursue the matter.
docstart_1327testb_court.Alexander Downer: Alexander Downer 's government established a new inquiry head to lead it, despite calls for an open investigation into paedophilia in the Australian diplomatic service.

docstart_1341testb_feature.Singapore: Singapore saw prestige in hosting the WTO ministerial meeting, which would bring in 4,000 officials from 160 countries.
docstart_1341testb_feature.WTO: WTO Ministerial Meeting is being held in Singapore because it has a strong interest in free trade and wants to be a part of shaping global free trade rules.
docstart_1341testb_feature.SINGAPORE: SINGAPORE 1996-12-06 saw prestige in hosting the World Trade Organization's first ministerial meeting, reflecting its ambition to play a key role in shaping global free trade. The city-state met U.S. opposition two years ago in its bid to host the meeting, expected to gather 4,000 officials from 160 countries. In a stand some analysts linked to controversy over Singapore's caning of an American teenager for vandalism, then-U.S. Trade Representative Mickey Kantor had said the meeting ought to be held where the WTO was going to be headquartered. That would have meant Geneva. But Singapore had the support of other WTO members, and the meeting would be good for Singapore's tourism industry.
U.S. opposition two years ago in its bid to host the meeting, expected to gather 4,000 officials from 160 countries from December 9 to 13, had said the meeting ought to be held where the WTO was going to be headquartered. But Singapore had the support of other WTO members, and the meeting would be good for Singapore's tourism industry.
docstart_1341testb_feature.Mickey Kantor: Mickey Kantor , then-U.S. Trade Representative, said that the WTO's first ministerial meeting should be held in Geneva, but Singapore had the support of other WTO members and won the bid to host the meeting. The city-state met U.S. opposition two years ago in its bid to host the meeting, expected to gather 4,000 officials from 160 countries.
docstart_1341testb_feature.Geneva: Geneva was the original location for the WTO ministerial meeting, but Singapore won the bid after convincing other WTO members. The meeting has a lot of symbolism for Singapore, and it would be good for the city-state's tourism industry.
docstart_1341testb_feature.National University of Singapore: National University of Singapore economist Tan Kong Yam expects the meeting to be good for Singapore's tourism industry and its workforce, but most Singaporeans are not too concerned about some of the issues.
docstart_1341testb_feature.Uruguay: Uruguay Round of trade negotiations led by the World Trade Organization; conference to be held in Singapore to review the work of the WTO and the implementation of the free trade commitments made during the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade.
docstart_1341testb_feature.European Union: European Union and other trading powers called on Singapore to speed up the opening of its services sector, but Singapore had the support of other WTO members. The city-state met U.S. opposition two years ago in its bid to host the meeting, expected to gather 4,000 officials from 160 countries from December 9 to 13. In a stand some analysts linked to controversy over Singapore's caning of an American teenager for vandalism, then-U.S. Trade Representative Mickey Kantor had said the meeting ought to be held where the WTO was going to be headquartered. But Singapore had the support of other WTO members. Derek da Cunha, senior fellow at the Institute of Policy Studies (ISEAS), said Singapore's hosting of the conference "carries a great deal of symbolism for the city-state, underscoring its commitment to free trade and its trading links across the globe." There is the international prestige Singapore would enjoy, but "more importantly there is a genuine national interest in fostering better global free trade and an open market," said Tan Kong Yam, head of Business Policy at the National University of Singapore. docstart_1347testb_golf.TARPON SPRINGS: TARPON SPRINGS , Florida - The third round of the JCPenney Classic was washed out due to heavy rains, and the final round will be played in the alternate shot format on Sunday. The duo of reigning U.S. Amateur champions Kelli Kuehne and Tiger Woods were tied for the lead with the team of Donna Andrews and Mike Hulbert at 13-under-par 129 through 36 holes while the tandem of Pat Hurst and Scott McCarron were another shot back at 12-under 130. Defending champions Beth Daniel and Davis Love will start the final round six shots off the pace.

docstart_1351testb_nordic.Behle: Behle won the biathlon world cup, while Paramygina and Greiner-Petter-Memm finished second and third, respectively.
docstart_1351testb_nordic.Paramygina: Paramygina won the women's 7.5 km race, followed by Behle and Greiner-Petter-Memm. Sashurin won the men's 10 km race, followed by Andresen and Fischer.

docstart_1353testb_bobsleigh-shimer.Austria: Austria 's two-man bobsleigh event was won by USA III, which was led by Brian Shimer and Randy Jones. The Canadians were second, and the Americans were tenth. This was the third World Cup event of the winter, and the Canadians increased their lead in the standings.
docstart_1353testb_bobsleigh-shimer.Brian Shimer: Brian Shimer and Randy Jones of the United States surprised the world with their victory in a two-man bobsleigh race on Saturday. Shimer and Jones delivered a near-perfect second trip down the 1976 Olympic course for an aggregate time of one minute 45.91 seconds, which was two hundredths of a second behind the leaders. Canada I, represented by Pierre Lueders and breakman Dave MacEachern, completed the third World cup event of the winter a further one-hundredth of a second behind the Italians. The Canadians, winners of the opening two events in Altenberg, Germany, and La Plagne, France, increased their lead in the World Cup standings.
docstart_1353testb_bobsleigh-shimer.Shimer: Shimer and Jones delivered a near-perfect second trip down the 1976 Olympic course for an aggregate time of one minute 45.91 seconds to surprise win the World Cup two-man bobsleigh race. Canada I, represented by Pierre Lueders and breakman Dave MacEachern, completed the third World cup event of the winter a further one-hundredth of a second behind the Italians. The Canadians, winners of the opening two events in Altenberg, Germany, and La Plagne, France, increased their lead in the World Cup standings.
docstart_1353testb_bobsleigh-shimer.Randy Jones: Randy Jones and Brian Shimer piloted USA III to victory in a two-man bobsleigh race on Saturday, surprising the competition by delivering a near-perfect second trip down the track. Canada I, represented by Pierre Lueders and Dave MacEachern, finished second, two hundredths of a second behind the Americans. The Canadians lead the World Cup standings with 104 points.
docstart_1353testb_bobsleigh-shimer.Olympic: Olympic course in Bobsleigh, USA III piloted by Brian Shimer won a surprise victory over Italy I sleigh led by Guenther Huber and Antonio Tartaglia. Canada I, represented by Pierre Lueders and breakman Dave MacEachern, finished third. This increased their lead in the World Cup standings.
docstart_1353testb_bobsleigh-shimer.Antonio Tartaglia: Antonio Tartaglia and Guenther Huber were the first runners in the World Cup two-man bobsleigh race, but Brian Shimer and Randy Jones beat them to the finish line. Canada I, represented by Pierre Lueders and Dave MacEachern, finished second. This victory increased the Canadians' lead in the World Cup standings.
docstart_1353testb_bobsleigh-shimer.Italy: Italy 's Guenther Huber and breakman Antonio Tartaglia narrowly edged out USA's Brian Shimer and Randy Jones to take second place in a World Cup bobsleigh race on Saturday. The Canadians, who had already won two events, increased their lead in the World Cup standings as a result.
docstart_1353testb_bobsleigh-shimer.Pierre Lueders: Pierre Lueders and Dave MacEachern of Canada I surprised the field by winning the two-man bobsleigh event at the World Cup in Austria on Saturday. Lueders and MacEachern beat Antonio Tartaglia and Guenther Huber of Italy I by two-hundredths of a second. This gave Canada a significant lead in the World Cup standings.
docstart_1353testb_bobsleigh-shimer.Altenberg: Altenberg , Germany, and La Plagne, France, were the two previous World Cup events for the United States, and Brian Shimer and Randy Jones delivered a near-perfect second trip down the 1976 Olympic course for an aggregate time of one minute 45.91 seconds to surprise win the two-man bobsleigh race on Saturday. Canada I, represented by Pierre Lueders and breakman Dave MacEachern, completed the third World cup event of the winter a further one-hundredth of a second behind the Italians. The Canadians, winners of the opening two events in Altenberg, Germany, and La Plagne, France, increased their lead in the World Cup standings by 15 points over the United States.
docstart_1353testb_bobsleigh-shimer.Germany: Germany 's Guenther Huber and Italy's Antonio Tartaglia led the first run of Saturday's bobsleigh World Cup race, but Brian Shimer and Randy Jones of the United States came back to win in a surprise victory. Canada I, represented by Pierre Lueders and Dave MacEachern, was second, but increased their lead in the World Cup standings.
docstart_1353testb_bobsleigh-shimer.La Plagne: La Plagne , France, was the host of the final World Cup event of the winter, and the Canadians took first place. USA III, piloted by Brian Shimer and Randy Jones, surprised everyone by winning the race.
docstart_1353testb_bobsleigh-shimer.France: France 's Pierre Lueders and Dave MacEachern, Canada's Pierre Lueders and Jim Herberich, and Italy's Antonio Tartaglia and Garrett Hines all finished second in the two-man bobsleigh race on Saturday. The United States, represented by Brian Shimer and Randy Jones, won the race.
docstart_1353testb_bobsleigh-shimer.Garrett Hines: Garrett Hines and Jim Herberich finished 10th place in the World Cup two-man bobsleigh race on Saturday.

docstart_1354testb_skiing-chinese.TIGNES: TIGNES , France 1996-12-07 - China made a promising debut on the freestyle skiing world cup circuit with two women in the top 10 of the competition. France and Canada were the dominant teams.
docstart_1354testb_skiing-chinese.France: France dominated the freestyle skiing world cup circuit in an aerials event in the French resort of Tignes on Saturday, while China made a promising debut on the circuit.
docstart_1354testb_skiing-chinese.China: China made a promising debut on the freestyle skiing world cup circuit in an aerials event in the French resort of Tignes. While the Chinese failed to gain a place in the men's final, they had two in the top 10 of the women's competition.
docstart_1354testb_skiing-chinese.French: French skiers dominated the freestyle skiing world cup circuit on Saturday in Tignes, France. China made a promising debut on the circuit, but ultimately fell short in the men's final and women's competition. Canada and France were the only countries to win medals.

docstart_1354testb_skiing-chinese.Sebastien Foucras: Sebastien Foucras of France won the men's aerials event at Tignes, beating Alexis Blanc. Canada's Jeff Bean took third. Veronica Brenner of Canada won the women's event.
docstart_1354testb_skiing-chinese.Jeff Bean: Jeff Bean from Canada won the men's freestyle skiing event at Tignes, France, while Veronica Brenner from Canada won the women's event.
docstart_1354testb_skiing-chinese.Veronica Brenner: Veronica Brenner of Canada won the women's freestyle skiing event at Tignes, France and Karin Kuster of Switzerland came in second.
docstart_1354testb_skiing-chinese.Swiss: Swiss skiers occupied the other two places on the podium, Karin Kuster taking second with 160.55 narrowly ahead of Evelyne Leu with 160.36.

docstart_1355testb_bobsleigh-world.Austria: Austria won the World Cup two-man bobsleigh event on Saturday. The United States, Italy, Canada, Germany, and Czech Republic all competed. Austria was first, followed by the United States, Italy, Canada, Germany, and Czech Republic in that order.

docstart_1355testb_bobsleigh-world.Antonio Tartaglia: Antonio Tartaglia and Guenther Huber won the World Cup two-man bobsleigh event on Saturday. Italy I finished second, Canada I third, and Germany I fourth. The United States finished fifth, and Austria III sixth.
docstart_1355testb_bobsleigh-world.Pierre Lueders: Pierre Lueders and Dave MacEachern of Canada beat Guenther Huber and Antonio Tartaglia of Italy in the World Cup two-man bobsleigh event on Saturday.
docstart_1355testb_bobsleigh-world.Sepp Dostthaler: Sepp Dostthaler and Thomas Lebsa of Germany finished first and second in the two-man bobsleigh event Saturday, followed by Antonio Tartaglia and Guenther Huber of Italy, Pierre Lueders and Dave MacEachern of Canada, and Dirk Wiese and Jakobs Marco of Germany.
docstart_1355testb_bobsleigh-world.Reto Goetschi: Reto Goetschi and Guido Acklin of Switzerland won the two-man bobsleigh race at the Bobsleigh-World Cup on Saturday. Switzerland was ahead of Germany and Austria at the end of the race, but Germany passed Switzerland to take second place.

docstart_1355testb_bobsleigh-world.Garrett Hines: Garrett Hines and Jim Herberich finished the two-man event in first and second place, respectively.

docstart_1356testb_cricket.WOOLMER: WOOLMER RETURNS TO KANPUR, INDIA FOR TEST AS SOUTH AFRICA COACH
docstart_1356testb_cricket.KANPUR: KANPUR , India 1996-12-07 Bob Woolmer, 48, a former English cricket player, returns to his birthplace in Kanpur to coach South Africa in the third test against India. He remembers little of the city but recalls having a cobra snake in the basement of their house and the hospital where he was born is close to the stadium where the test is being played.
docstart_1356testb_cricket.India: India played against South Africa in Kanpur as part of a three-test match series. Bob Woolmer, who played for England between 1975 and 1981, made a return to his birthplace to watch the match. He remembered that his father, who also played cricket, had a cobra snake in their house and that the hospital where he was born is close to the stadium.
docstart_1356testb_cricket.South Africa: South Africa 's trip to Kanpur for the third test against India has given former England test cricketer Bob Woolmer the chance of a sentimental return to his birthplace. Woolmer, now the South African coach, said on Saturday that the visit was a sentimental journey. Woolmer, aged 48, played 19 tests for England between 1975 and 1981. His first cricketing sojurn to India was as a member of Tony Greig's England side in 1976-77. His father Clarence Woolmer represented United Province, now renamed Uttar Pradesh, in India's Ranji Trophy national championship and captained the state during 1949. Now aged 86, Woolmer senior lives with his son in Cape Town. Woolmer's memories of Kanpur are few and blurred, but he does remember we had a cobra snake in the basement of our house and that his father bought a bicycle and when we rode over a hose pipe it broke into two.
docstart_1356testb_cricket.Kanpur: Kanpur , India is where Bob Woolmer was born and raised. He has fond memories of the city and is looking forward to visiting it again while coaching South Africa in their test against India.
docstart_1356testb_cricket.England: England 's former test cricketer Bob Woolmer has returned to his birthplace in Kanpur for the third test against India. He is nostalgic about his previous visit to India, which was as a member of Tony Greig's England side in 1976-77.
docstart_1356testb_cricket.Bob Woolmer: Bob Woolmer , a former English test cricketer, has a sentimental journey to India to visit his birthplace. He talks about his memories of playing cricket in Kanpur, and how his father was an active cricketer.
docstart_1356testb_cricket.Woolmer: Woolmer , a former English test cricketer, has a nostalgic journey to Kanpur, his birthplace, to watch the third test against India. He remembers the cobra snake in the basement of his house, and the bicycle that broke when they rode over a hose pipe.
docstart_1356testb_cricket.Tony Greig: Tony Greig 's England side played a test match against India in 1976-77, and Bob Woolmer was born in Kanpur at the time. He has returned to his birthplace to watch the test match, and he is excited about it.
docstart_1356testb_cricket.Clarence Woolmer: Clarence Woolmer , the son of an insurance company employee, played cricket for England and was a coach in South Africa. He is returning to his birthplace, Kanpur, for a test match between India and South Africa.
docstart_1356testb_cricket.Uttar Pradesh: Uttar Pradesh , now renamed Uttar Pradesh, represented United Province, now renamed Uttar Pradesh, in India's Ranji Trophy national championship and captained the state during 1949. Bob Woolmer, now the South African coach, grew up in Kanpur and has a sentimental return to his birthplace. The India-South Africa test will be played at the stadium where he was born.
docstart_1356testb_cricket.Cape Town: Cape Town -born Bob Woolmer, now the South African coach, has a sentimental return to his birthplace of Kanpur for the third test against India.
docstart_1356testb_cricket.Calcutta: Calcutta , India, was where Bob Woolmer was born and raised. He went to India for the third test against India and it was a sentimental journey to see his old home country.

docstart_1371testb_soccer.VIEIRA: VIEIRA saved Arsenal from losing against Derby with a last-minute equalizer.

docstart_1371testb_soccer.Patrick Vieira: Patrick Vieira saved Arsenal from a loss against Derby with a last-minute equalizer.
docstart_1371testb_soccer.Arsenal: Arsenal 's lead was overturned by a two-goal burst from forwards Dean Sturridge and Darryl Powell, but Frenchman Patrick Vieira saved the day with a last minute equalizer.
docstart_1371testb_soccer.Derby: Derby 's two-goal burst from forwards Dean Sturridge and Darryl Powell overturned Arsenal's 1-0 lead from a diving header by captain Tony Adams, but Frenchman Patrick Vieira saved the day with a last-minute equalizer.
docstart_1371testb_soccer.London: London premier league leaders Arsenal were rocked by a two-goal burst from forwards Dean Sturridge and Darryl Powell in the 62nd and 71st minutes, but French midfielder Patrick Vieira saved the day with a last-minute equalizer.
docstart_1371testb_soccer.Dean Sturridge: Dean Sturridge and Darryl Powell scored two goals for Derby in the 62nd and 71st minutes to overturn Arsenal's 1-0 lead, but Frenchman Patrick Vieira scored a last-minute goal to salvage a 2-2 draw for English premier league leaders Arsenal.
docstart_1371testb_soccer.Darryl Powell: Darryl Powell and Dean Sturridge scored two goals in the second half to overturn Arsenal's 1-0 lead, but Frenchman Patrick Vieira saved the day with a last-minute equalizer.
docstart_1371testb_soccer.Tony Adams: Tony Adams ' header for Arsenal at halftime turned the game around and Derby scored in the 62nd and 71st minutes to take the lead, but Frenchman Patrick Vieira saved Arsenal with a last-minute equalizer.
docstart_1371testb_soccer.Liverpool: Liverpool were upset by a 1-0 goal from Sheffield Wednesday's Guy Whittingham, while Arsenal salvaged a 2-2 draw against Derby with a last-minute goal by Frenchman Patrick Vieira.
docstart_1371testb_soccer.Guy Whittingham: Guy Whittingham scored for Sheffield Wednesday to give Liverpool their first home league defeat of the season, while Patrick Vieira saved Arsenal from a two-goal deficit with a last-minute equalizer.
docstart_1371testb_soccer.Sheffield Wednesday: Sheffield Wednesday suffered an upset first home league defeat of the season, beaten 1-0 by Guy Whittingham for Liverpool. Wimbledon leap-fropped over Liverpool into second place by winning 3-1 at Sunderland.
docstart_1371testb_soccer.Wimbledon: Wimbledon leap-frogged over Liverpool into second place by winning 3-1 at Sunderland to extend their unbeaten league and cup run to 18 games.
docstart_1371testb_soccer.Sunderland: Sunderland 's Guy Whittingham scored an early goal for Sheffield Wednesday, but Wimbledon's Efan Ekoku and Dean Holdsworth scored late to win 3-1.
docstart_1371testb_soccer.Efan Ekoku: Efan Ekoku scored two goals for Wimbledon in their victory over Sunderland, leapfrogging Liverpool into second place in the Premier League.
docstart_1371testb_soccer.Dean Holdsworth: Dean Holdsworth scored a late goal to help Wimbledon beat Sunderland 3-1 to move up to second in the English Premier League.

docstart_1377testb_soccer.ALBANIA: ALBANIA 'S SQUAD TO PLAY N.IRELAND IN WORLD CUP GROUP 9 QUALIFIER ON SATURDAY WILL CONTAIN A NUMBER OF PLAYERS WHO HAVE SUSTAINED INJURIES AFTER BEING SUSPENDED DURING THE PAST TWO WEEKS.
docstart_1377testb_soccer.TIRANA: TIRANA 1996-12-07 Albanian coach Astrit Hafizi said on Saturday it was important that his players brush aside the country's short ban by FIFA in order to concentrate on next Saturday'sWorld Cup group nine qualifier against Northern Ireland.
docstart_1377testb_soccer.Northern Ireland: Northern Ireland is Albania's opponent in a World Cup qualifier on Saturday; the country has been reinstated by FIFA and the players are focusing on the game.
docstart_1377testb_soccer.Albania: Albania 's football team has been reinstated by FIFA and they are scheduled to play against Northern Ireland next Saturday. The team is hoping to secure a draw in their World Cup qualifier against the Northern Irish team.
docstart_1377testb_soccer.Balkan: Balkan country's government lifted suspensions on various soccer officials, which allowed Albanian Football Association general secretary Eduard Dervishi to be reinstated and the executive committee to be dissolved. FIFA had banned Albania indefinitely after its sports ministry had ordered the suspension of Albanian Football Association general secretary Eduard Dervishi and dissolved the executive committee. The reinstated Albania named a squad to play Northern Ireland on Saturday.
docstart_1377testb_soccer.Albanian Football Association: Albanian Football Association reinstated Albania last Tuesday after the Balkan country's government lifted suspensions on various soccer officials. The Albanian squad will play Northern Ireland in a World Cup group nine qualifier on Saturday.
docstart_1377testb_soccer.Belfast: Belfast is the game Albanian team will play on Saturday, and they will be happy with a draw. The team has a few injured players, but is otherwise healthy.
docstart_1377testb_soccer.Artur Lekbello: Artur Lekbello , who is injured, was missing from Astrit Hafizi's squad named on Saturday for the Belfast match.

docstart_1378testb_cricket.VICTORIA: VICTORIA FIGHT BACK IN SHEFFIELD SHIELD MATCH AGAINST TASMANIA, WITH DEAN JONES MAKING AN UNBELIEVABLE 130 NOT OUT TO LEAD THE FIGHTBACK.

docstart_1380testb_soccer.SOUTH KOREA: SOUTH KOREA MADE VIRTUALLY CERTAIN OF AN ASIAN CUP QUARTER-FINAL SPOT WITH A 4-2 WIN OVER INDONESIA IN A GROUP A MATCH ON SATURDAY. AFTER GOING FOUR UP IN THE FIRST 55 MINUTES SOUTH KOREA ALLOWED INDONESIA, NEWCOMERS TO ASIAN CUP FINALS, BACK INTO THE MATCH, CONDEMNING TWO GOALS FROM RARE COUNTER ATTACKS. KIM DO HOOON OPENED THE SCORE FOR SOUTH KOREA IN ONLY THE FIFTH MINUTE, TURNING UNUNDER COVERED ON THE PENALTY SCENE TO FIRE A SHOT INTO THE TOP CORNER. IT LOOKED LIKE TURNING INTO A ROUT AS HWANG SUN HONG RAPIDLY ADDED TWO MORE IN THE SEVENTH AND 15TH MINUTES BUT WHILE THE KOREANS CONTINUED TO DOMINATE THEY FAILED TO ADD TO THE SCORE BEFORE THE INTERVAL. BUT THEY STARTED THE SECOND HALF WHERE THEY HAD LEFT OFF AND IT WAS NOT LONG BEFORE THEY WENT FOUR UP, KO JE
docstart_1380testb_soccer.South Korea: South Korea made virtually certain of an Asian Cup quarter-final spot with a 4-2 win over Indonesia.
docstart_1380testb_soccer.Asian Cup: Asian Cup quarter-final spot virtually certain for South Korea after 4-2 win over Indonesia on Saturday.
docstart_1380testb_soccer.Indonesia: Indonesia , a newcomer to the Asian Cup finals, were unable to take South Korea down, conceding two goals in the process. In the second half, South Korea went on to win by four goals.
docstart_1380testb_soccer.Kuwait: Kuwait lost to South Korea 4-2 in the first match of Group A. South Korea then went on to win their next two matches by a combined score of 10-1, clinching an Asian Cup spot. Indonesia, a new team to the Asian Cup, was able to score in the first 55 minutes of the match but South Korea was able to hold on and win 4-2.
docstart_1380testb_soccer.Hendro Kartiko: Hendro Kartiko saved all four of South Korea's penalties in the match, holding Indonesia scoreless until Ronny Wabia scored in the last minute of the match. South Korea went on to win the match 4-2.
docstart_1380testb_soccer.Agung Setyabudi: Agung Setyabudi scored for Indonesia in the 65th minute to make the score 4-2, but South Korea still came out on top with two goals in the last three minutes to win the match.
docstart_1380testb_soccer.Bima Sakti: Bima Sakti equalized for Indonesia in the 86th minute, but South Korea held on for a 4-2 win in their Group A match.

docstart_1393testb_soccer.CHARLTON: CHARLTON WAS MADE AN HONORARY IRISHMAN DUE TO HIS ACHIEVEMENTS AS MANAGER OF THE REPUBLIC OF IRELAND.
docstart_1393testb_soccer.DUBLIN: DUBLIN , 1996-12-07 - Jack Charlton's relationship with the people of Ireland was cemented on Saturday when he was officially declared one of their own. He managed Ireland for 93 matches, during which time they lost only 17 times in almost 10 years until he resigned in December 1995. He guided Ireland to two successive World Cup finals tournaments and to the 1988 European championship finals in Germany, after the Irish beat a well-fancied England team 1-0 in their group qualifier. The lanky former Leeds United defender did not make his England debut until the age of 30 but eventually won 35 caps and was a key member of the 1966 World Cup winning team with his younger brother, Bobby.
docstart_1393testb_soccer.Jack Charlton: Jack Charlton was made an honorary Irishman on Saturday due to his accomplishments as the manager of the Republic of Ireland soccer team.
docstart_1393testb_soccer.Ireland: Ireland has declared Jack Charlton an honorary Irishman in recognition of his successful years as manager of the Republic of Ireland.
docstart_1393testb_soccer.Charlton: Charlton , 61, and his wife, Peggy, became citizens of Ireland on Saturday. He is being honored for his accomplishments as the manager of the Republic of Ireland, which culminated in the team's two consecutive World Cup tournaments and 1988 European championship finals.
docstart_1393testb_soccer.Dick Spring: Dick Spring , the deputy prime minister of Ireland, declared Jack Charlton an honorary Irishman because of his achievements as manager of the Republic of Ireland.
docstart_1393testb_soccer.Republic of Ireland: Republic of Ireland national soccer manager Jack Charlton is officially declared an honorary Irishman in recognition of his achievements.
docstart_1393testb_soccer.Germany: Germany 's Jack Charlton is officially made an honorary Irishman in recognition of his achievements as manager of the Republic of Ireland. He and his wife, Peggy, become Irish citizens and are emotional about the honor.
docstart_1393testb_soccer.England: England 's Jack Charlton is officially declared an honorary Irishman due to his accomplishments as the manager of Ireland's national soccer team.
docstart_1393testb_soccer.Leeds United: Leeds United defender Jack Charlton became an honorary Irishman on Saturday because of his time managing the Republic of Ireland soccer team.
docstart_1393testb_soccer.1966 World Cup: 1966 World Cup winner and soccer manager, Jack Charlton, is officially declared one of the Irish people. He and his wife, Peggy, became citizens of Ireland on Saturday. The joy and friendship he shared with the people of Ireland during his time as manager is what made the honor so emotional for him.
